intro: Biscutella obcordata, commonly known as the heartleaf biscuitroot, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of obcordate (heart-shaped) leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in early spring. It is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Biscutella obcordata is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
